contents.text: 11.2. Aligning Compressed Meta-Blocks to Byte Boundaries
contents.zh-CHS: 11.2. 将压缩的元块与字节边界对齐

contents.text: As described in Section 9, only those meta-blocks that immediately follow an uncompressed meta-block or a metadata meta-block are guaranteed to start on a byte boundary. In some applications, it might be required that every non-metadata meta-block starts on a byte boundary. This can be achieved by appending an empty metadata meta-block after every non-metadata meta-block that does not end on a byte boundary.
contents.zh-CHS: 如第9节所述，只有紧跟在未压缩元块或元数据元块之后的元块才能保证从字节边界开始。在某些应用程序中，可能要求每个非元数据元块从字节边界开始。这可以通过在每个不在字节边界上结束的非元数据元块之后附加一个空元数据元块来实现。

contents.text: 11.3. Creating Self-Contained Parts within the Compressed Data
contents.zh-CHS: 11.3. 在压缩数据中创建自包含的部分

contents.text: In some encoder implementations, it might be required to make a sequence of bytes within a brotli stream self-contained, that is, such that they can be decompressed independently from previous parts of the compressed data. This is a useful feature for three reasons. First, if a large compressed file is damaged, it is possible to recover some of the file after the damage. Second, it is useful when doing differential transfer of compressed data. If a sequence of uncompressed bytes is unchanged and compressed independently from previous data, then the compressed representation may also be unchanged and can therefore be transferred very cheaply. Third, if sequences of uncompressed bytes are compressed independently, it allows for parallel compression of these byte sequences within the same file, in addition to parallel compression of multiple files.
contents.zh-CHS: 在一些编码器实现中，可能需要使brotli流中的字节序列自包含，即，可以独立于压缩数据的先前部分对其进行解压缩。这是一个有用的特性，原因有三。首先，如果一个大的压缩文件被损坏，可以在损坏后恢复部分文件。其次，它在对压缩数据进行差分传输时非常有用。如果未压缩字节序列未被改变并且与先前的数据独立地被压缩，则压缩表示也可以被改变，并且因此可以非常便宜地传输。第三，如果未压缩字节序列被独立压缩，那么除了并行压缩多个文件外，还允许在同一文件中并行压缩这些字节序列。

contents.text: Given two sequences of uncompressed bytes, U0 and U1, we will now describe how to create two sequences of compressed bytes, C0 and C1, such that the concatenation of C0 and C1 is a valid brotli stream, and that C0 and C1 (together with the first byte of C0 that contains the window size) can be decompressed independently from each other to U0 and U1.
contents.zh-CHS: 给定两个未压缩字节序列U0和U1，我们现在将描述如何创建两个压缩字节序列C0和C1，以便C0和C1的串联是有效的brotli流，C0和C1（以及包含窗口大小的C0的第一个字节）可以相互独立地解压缩到U0和U1。

contents.text: When compressing the byte sequence U0 to produce C0, we can use any compressor that works on the complete set of uncompressed bytes U0, with the following two changes. First, the ISLAST bit of the last meta-block of C0 must not be set. Second, C0 must end at a byte-boundary, which can be ensured by appending an empty metadata meta-block to it, as in Section 11.2.
contents.zh-CHS: 当压缩字节序列U0以产生C0时，我们可以使用任何对完整的未压缩字节集U0工作的压缩器，并进行以下两个更改。首先，不能设置C0最后一个元块的ISLAST位。其次，C0必须在字节边界处结束，这可以通过向其附加一个空元数据元块来确保，如第11.2节所示。

contents.text: When compressing the byte sequence U1 to produce C1, we can use any compressor that starts a new meta-block at the beginning of U1 within the U0+U1 input stream, with the following two changes. First, backward distances in C1 must not refer to static dictionary words or uncompressed bytes in U0. Even if a sequence of bytes in U1 would match a static dictionary word, or a sequence of bytes that overlaps U0, the compressor must represent this sequence of bytes with a combination of literal insertions and backward references to bytes in U1 instead. Second, the ring buffer of last four distances must be replenished first with distances in C1 before using it to encode other distances in C1. Note that both compressors producing C0 and C1 have to use the same window size, but the stream header is emitted only by the compressor that produces C0.
contents.zh-CHS: 当压缩字节序列U1以产生C1时，我们可以使用在U0+U1输入流中的U1开始处启动新元块的任何压缩器，并进行以下两个更改。首先，C1中的向后距离不能指U0中的静态字典单词或未压缩字节。即使U1中的字节序列与静态字典单词匹配，或者与U0重叠的字节序列匹配，压缩器也必须使用文本插入和对U1中字节的反向引用的组合来表示该字节序列。第二，最后四个距离的环形缓冲区必须首先用C1中的距离进行补充，然后再使用它对C1中的其他距离进行编码。请注意，产生C0和C1的两个压缩机必须使用相同的窗口大小，但流标题仅由产生C0的压缩机排放。

contents.text: Note that this method can be easily generalized to more than two sequences of uncompressed bytes.
contents.zh-CHS: 请注意，此方法可以很容易地推广到两个以上的未压缩字节序列。

contents.text: 12. Security Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 12. 安全考虑

contents.text: As with any compressed file formats, decompressor implementations should handle all compressed data byte sequences, not only those that conform to this specification, where non-conformant compressed data sequences should be rejected as invalid.
contents.zh-CHS: 与任何压缩文件格式一样，解压器实现应该处理所有压缩数据字节序列，而不仅仅是那些符合本规范的字节序列，其中不一致的压缩数据序列应该被视为无效而拒绝。

contents.text: A possible attack against a system containing a decompressor implementation (e.g., a web browser) is to exploit a buffer overflow triggered by invalid compressed data. Therefore, decompressor implementations should perform bounds-checking for each memory access that result from values decoded from the compressed stream and derivatives thereof.
contents.zh-CHS: 针对包含解压器实现（例如web浏览器）的系统的可能攻击是利用由无效压缩数据触发的缓冲区溢出。因此，解压器实现应该对从压缩流及其衍生物解码的值产生的每个内存访问执行边界检查。

contents.text: Another possible attack against a system containing a decompressor implementation is to provide it (either valid or invalid) compressed data that can make the decompressor system's resource consumption (CPU, memory, or storage) to be disproportionately large compared to the size of the compressed data. In addition to the size of the compressed data, the amount of CPU, memory, and storage required to decompress a single compressed meta-block within a brotli stream is controlled by the following two parameters: the size of the uncompressed meta-block, which is encoded at the start of the compressed meta-block, and the size of the sliding window, which is encoded at the start of the brotli stream. Decompressor implementations in systems where memory or storage is constrained should perform a sanity-check on these two parameters. The uncompressed meta-block size that was decoded from the compressed stream should be compared against either a hard limit, given by the system's constraints or some expectation about the uncompressed data, or against a certain multiple of the size of the compressed data. If the uncompressed meta-block size is determined to be too high, the compressed data should be rejected. Likewise, when the complete uncompressed stream is kept in the system containing the decompressor implementation, the total uncompressed size of the stream should be checked before decompressing each additional meta-block. If the size of the sliding window that was decoded from the start of the compressed stream is greater than a certain soft limit, then the decompressor implementation should, at first, allocate a smaller sliding window that fits the first uncompressed meta-block, and afterwards, before decompressing each additional meta-block, it should increase the size of the sliding window until the sliding window size specified in the compressed data is reached.
contents.zh-CHS: 针对包含解压器实现的系统的另一种可能攻击是提供（有效或无效）压缩数据，这会使解压器系统的资源消耗（CPU、内存或存储）与压缩数据的大小不成比例地大。除了压缩数据的大小外，解压brotli流中单个压缩元块所需的CPU、内存和存储量由以下两个参数控制：未压缩元块的大小（在压缩元块开始时编码）和滑动窗口的大小，在brotli流的开始处进行编码。在内存或存储受到限制的系统中，解压器实现应该对这两个参数执行健全性检查。应将从压缩流解码的未压缩元块大小与硬限制（由系统的约束或对未压缩数据的某些期望给出）或压缩数据大小的特定倍数进行比较。如果确定未压缩的元块大小过高，则应拒绝压缩数据。同样，当完整的未压缩流保存在包含解压器实现的系统中时，应在解压每个附加元块之前检查流的总未压缩大小。如果从压缩流开始解码的滑动窗口的大小大于某个软限制，则解压器实现应首先分配适合第一个未压缩元块的较小滑动窗口，然后在解压每个附加元块之前，它应该增加滑动窗口的大小，直到达到压缩数据中指定的滑动窗口大小。

contents.text: Correspondingly, possible attacks against a system containing a compressor implementation (e.g., a web server) are to exploit a buffer overflow or cause disproportionately large resource consumption by providing, e.g., uncompressible data. As described in Section 11.1, an output buffer of
contents.zh-CHS: 相应地，针对包含压缩器实现（例如，web服务器）的系统的可能攻击是利用缓冲区溢出或通过提供（例如）不可压缩的数据导致不成比例的巨大资源消耗。如第11.1节所述，输出缓冲器

contents.text: bytes is sufficient to hold a valid compressed brotli stream representing an arbitrary sequence of N uncompressed bytes. Therefore, compressor implementations should allocate at least S(N) bytes of output buffer before compressing N bytes of data with unknown compressibility and should perform bounds-checking for each write into this output buffer. If their output buffer is full, compressor implementations should revert to the trivial compression algorithm described in Section 11.1. The resource consumption of a compressor implementation for a particular input data depends mostly on the algorithm used to find backward matches and on the algorithm used to construct context maps and prefix codes and only to a lesser extent on the input data itself. If the system containing a compressor implementation is overloaded, a possible way to reduce resource usage is to switch to more simple algorithms for backward reference search and prefix code construction, or to fall back to the trivial compression algorithm described in Section 11.1.
contents.zh-CHS: 字节足以容纳表示任意N个未压缩字节序列的有效压缩brotli流。因此，压缩器实现应该在压缩具有未知压缩性的N字节数据之前分配至少S（N）字节的输出缓冲区，并且应该对写入该输出缓冲区的每次写入执行边界检查。如果输出缓冲区已满，则压缩器实现应恢复到第11.1节中描述的普通压缩算法。特定输入数据的压缩器实现的资源消耗主要取决于用于查找向后匹配的算法以及用于构造上下文映射和前缀代码的算法，并且在较小程度上取决于输入数据本身。如果包含压缩器实现的系统过载，减少资源使用的一种可能方法是切换到更简单的算法进行反向引用搜索和前缀代码构造，或者退回到第11.1节中描述的普通压缩算法。

contents.text: A possible attack against a system that sends compressed data over an encrypted channel is the following. An attacker who can repeatedly mix arbitrary (attacker-supplied) data with secret data (passwords, cookies) and observe the length of the ciphertext can potentially reconstruct the secret data. To protect against this kind of attack, applications should not mix sensitive data with non-sensitive, potentially attacker-supplied data in the same compressed stream.
contents.zh-CHS: 针对通过加密通道发送压缩数据的系统的可能攻击如下。攻击者可以重复地将任意（攻击者提供的）数据与机密数据（密码、cookie）混合，并观察密文的长度，从而有可能重构机密数据。为了防止此类攻击，应用程序不应在同一压缩流中混合敏感数据和可能由攻击者提供的非敏感数据。

contents.text: 13. IANA Considerations
contents.zh-CHS: 13. IANA考虑

contents.zh-CHS: “HTTP内容编码注册表”已更新，注册如下：

contents.text: 14. Informative References

contents.text: Appendix B. List of Word Transformations
contents.zh-CHS: 附录B.单词转换列表

contents.text: The string literals are in C format, with respect to the use of backslash escape characters.
contents.zh-CHS: 就反斜杠转义字符的使用而言，字符串文字为C格式。

contents.text: In order to generate a length and check value, the transforms can be converted to a series of bytes, where each transform is the prefix sequence of bytes plus a terminating zero byte, a single-byte value identifying the transform, and the suffix sequence of bytes plus a terminating zero. The value for the transforms are 0 for Identity, 1 for FermentFirst, 2 for FermentAll, 3 to 11 for OmitFirst1 to OmitFirst9, and 12 to 20 for OmitLast1 to OmitLast9. The byte sequences that represent the 121 transforms are then concatenated to a single sequence of bytes. The length of that sequence is 648 bytes, and the CRC-32 is 0x3d965f81.
contents.zh-CHS: 为了生成长度和检查值，可以将转换转换为一系列字节，其中每个转换是字节的前缀序列加上终止零字节、标识转换的单字节值以及字节的后缀序列加上终止零。转换的值为0表示标识，1表示酵素第一，2表示酵素所有，3到11表示省略第一个1表示省略第一个9，12到20表示省略第一个1表示省略第九个。然后，表示121个变换的字节序列被连接到单个字节序列。该序列的长度为648字节，CRC-32为0x3d965f81。
